body:
Fixed: Displaying HTML formatted text properly again with new Burp versions
Fixed: Changed JSON library to prevent erroneous encoding when pretty printing JWT contents
Feature: Support for o365 JWT attack
Feature: Support for keys in hexadecimal form
Misc: Refactoring

- Support for BURPs dark theme
- Bugfixes & Refactoring
- Updating old libraries

Big thanks to @DolphFlynn 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7944573/153608700-ded5d15a-87da-459c-800f-9799b6c51dbc.png)

name: Bugfix
body:
Added by @DolphFlynn 
Fixed NPE when key null and using JWT tokens with RS256 or ES256 algorithms

name: Realtime Intercept Tab
body:
- The intercept tab now provides realtime updates to the JWT
- Redesigned intercept tab GUI elements
- Bug fixes

name: Compability with Pro v2021.2
body:
JWT4B is now compatible with Burp Pro v2021.2 and doesn't require a restart of burp after initializing the plugin anymore, in order to be able to type in the JWT text areas.

Furthermore, the UI layout was improved in order to work better with smaller window sizes / scaling and text area border frames (due to the new look and feel of burp).

name: Bugfix
body: - Addressing #45  by removing a change that stripped newlines in secrets

name: 1.13 - Bug Fixes
body:
Fixes:
- Big numbers such as 1598358554.3746235 (i.E. in EXP / IAT attributes) won't be automatically set to exponential notation
- Improved UI in intercept tab after sending a request in the JWT tab, by displaying an empty token

name: Improved Error Handling
body: No new features, but JWT4B is now more tolerant about invalid tokens / json.

Whats new?

- Added config option "resetEditor", disabled this option will keep the editor state in the intercept tab for subsequent messages.
- Text areas now work with Burp 2020v4!
- Refactoring (inlcuding removal of deprecated observer pattern)

Whats new?
- More config options in the config.json file (interceptComment, cveAttackModePublicKey, cveAttackModePrivateKey)
- All output is now visible in the extender output / errors tab accordingly, instead of using sysout
- Fixing a rare crash on extension load / reload
- adding exp/iat/nbf support for double unix time (i.E. 1575374269.185791)
- Fixing output time being stuck on extension load time

name: Configuration JSON
body:
JWT4B now loads settings from a json config file, see #33.
The file will be saved in your home directory in a folder called .JWT4B.

You can open the json file by clicking on the new "Config" Button:
![Extender Tab with Config Button](https://i.imgur.com/P1CBGGb.png)

Example of the default config file:
![Default config file](https://i.imgur.com/68YP3lu.png)

name: Bug fix - Parsing key material
body: 1.8.1 fixes issue #34 by properly stripping all key material start / end substrings.

name: Improved JWT Check Feedback
body:
Thanks to https://github.com/GanbaruTobi JWT4B now sports improved JWT Check Feedback.

+ Instead of the generic error message "Invalid Signature / wrong / key / claim failed" more detailed information is returned
+ JWT's with one or more failed claims with a valid signature result in the UI element turning yellow


![yellow](https://i.imgur.com/QGOZvFD.png)
![red](https://i.imgur.com/2iqe7Eh.png)

name: Improved interception view
body:
Features:
- Intercept view: Ability to load singing secret / key from a local file
- Intercept view: UI glitch when generating random signing key
- Intercept view: Improved UI 

Fixes:
- Missing logo in about tab
- Non standard conform "secure" and "httponly" flags are recognized

name: UI improvements and multi line secret support
body:
* Improved UI when using automated attacks
* Support for line breaks / multi line secrets when checking and signing JWTs
* Removed unnecessary debug messages on console.out
* Fixed NPE

name: Enhanced JWT Detection & new automated Attack
body:
1.5 adds enhanced JWT detection - thanks to www.brainloop.com
- in JSON format (e.g {"a":"......", "b":"J.W.T",..}, recognition also in nested JSON
- in Parameter format without keywords (e.g. a=bc&d=J.W.T)
- as plain JWT. (e.g. ab cd ef J.W.T hi )

Furthermore it adds a new automated attack for CVE-2018-0114 ( https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-0114 )

name: UI improvements
body:
+ Registered Claims & Cookie Flags for all views
+ Bug fix (including issue #20 )
+ UI improvements

name: Cookie Security Flags Indication + Fixes
body:
JWT's sent via Set-Cookie now give you visual feedback if the HttpOnly / secure flags are set.
Furthermore a bug was fixed when more than 2 cookies are transmitted in one Cookie: header or empty values are used.
 ![cookie flag](https://i.imgur.com/c6FPHQx.png)

name: Cookie & Post Body Support
body:
* JWT Detection
    * JWT Tokens in Cookie and Set-Cookie header are now magically detected and editable.
    * Post Body Parameters containing JWT ("id_token", "ID_TOKEN", "access_token", "token") are now detected and editable.
* Automated none alg. test available in intercept view
* History view
    * Requests containing a JWT are highlighted and marked via comment
* Improved about dialogue 
* New debug request / response files
* Bugfixes
    * Resigning with a random key is now acting as it should
    * A lot more small bugfixes
* JUnit Tests

name: Registered Claims and UI
body:
Whats new?
- Support for registered claims "exp", "nbf" and "iat"  - [Whats that?](https://self-issued.info/docs/draft-ietf-oauth-json-web-token.html#RegisteredClaimName)

- Bugfixes (signature check with minifed json content and UI tweaks)

- UI now displays exact problem on signature checks

name: Bugfixes
body:
1.0.1 contains two bugfixes:

- the tokens json is now minified before being re-encoded
- a null pointer exception in the intercept view was fixed

name: Version 1.0
body:
This is the first stable release of JWT4B.
If you run into any problems or you have a good idea for new features and improvements, let us know.
